features.name: Create a kicking ass project
features.description:
In order to start manage a project
As a project manager
I want to create a kicking ass project

elements.name: The one where it's a valid project

steps.name: I am signed in
I am on the home page
I fill in "New project name" with "Kicking ass project"
I fill in "Where is your tests results?" with "http://chronos-pm.heroku.com/cucumber.json"
I press "Create project"
I should see "Kicking ass project was created!"
I should be on the Kicking ass project page

features.name: View all
features.description:
In order to update my project based on my acceptance tests
As a project manager
I want to refresh my kicking ass project user stories

elements.name: The one where I refresh my kicking ass project

steps.name: I am signed in
I have a project called "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

steps.name: I am on this project page
I press "Refresh"
I should see "Fresh project!"

features.name: Sign in with my Facebook account
features.description:
In order to manage my personal projects
As a project manager
I want to sign in with my Facebook account

elements.name: The one where I am a new user

steps.name: I am on the home page
I follow "Sign in with Facebook"
I should see "Greetings Nícolas Iensen!"
I should not see "Sign in with Facebook"
I should be on the home page

features.name: View all my projects
features.description:
In order to browse between projects
As a project manager
I want to view all my projects

elements.name: The one where I have a project

steps.name: I am signed in
I have a project called "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

steps.name: I go to all projects page
I should see "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

elements.name: The one where I don't have any project

steps.name: I am signed in
I go to all projects page
I should see "How sad, you have no project yet"

arguments.val: How sad, you have no project yet

features.name: View my project user stories
features.description:
In order to keep track of all my project user stories
As a project manager
I want to view my project user stories

elements.name: The one where the project have no user story

steps.name: I am signed in
I have a project called "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

steps.name: I go to this project page
I should see "This project have no user story yet"

arguments.val: This project have no user story yet

elements.name: The one where the project have one pending user story

steps.name: I am signed in
I have a project called "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

steps.name: this project have a pending user story called "View my project user stories"
I go to this project page
I should see the pending story feature

elements.name: The one where the project have one implemented user story

steps.name: I am signed in
I have a project called "Chronos, the new amazing PM app"

arguments.val: Chronos, the new amazing PM app

steps.name: this project have a implemented user story called "View my project user stories"
I go to this project page
I should see the implemented story feature
